solution:
Note that
\[\mathbf{A}^2 = \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 \end{pmatrix} = \mathbf{0}.\]Therefore, $\mathbf{A}^n = \mathbf{0}$ for all $n \ge 2,$ which means
\begin{align*}
\mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A}^2 + 4 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb &= \mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} \\
&= \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix} + 2 \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 31 & 50 \\ -18 & -29 \end{pmatrix}}.
\end{align*}
model_solution:
## Step 1: Calculate $\mathbf{A}^2$
We have
\[\mathbf{A}^2 = \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 15(15) + 25(-9) & 15(25) + 25(-15) \\ -9(15) - 15(-9) & -9(25) - 15(-15) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 225 - 225 & 375 - 375 \\ -135 + 135 & -225 + 225 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 \end{pmatrix}.\]

The final answer is: $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 \end{pmatrix}}$

## Step 1: Calculate $\mathbf{A}^2$
We have
\[\mathbf{A}^2 = \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 15(15) + 25(-9) & 15(25) + 25(-15) \\ -9(15) - 15(-9) & -9(25) - 15(-15) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 225 - 225 & 375 - 375 \\ -135 + 135 & -225 + 225 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 \end{pmatrix}.\]

The final answer is: $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 \end{pmatrix}}$
